meanings.definition: Lack of power or ability to act or effect change.
meanings.sent1: Her impuissance in the situation left her feeling helpless.
meanings.sent2: The impuissance of the old machine made it difficult to complete the task.
meanings.sent3: Despite his impuissance in fixing the car, he tried his best to repair it.
meanings.sent4: The impuissance of the tiny seed to grow into a tree symbolized the struggle of life.
meanings.sent5: The impuissance of the flashlight in the dark forest left them scared and lost.

meanings.sent1: The impuissance of the medicine failed to cure the illness.
meanings.sent2: His impuissance in the gym showed his need for more training.
meanings.sent3: The impuissance of the leaky bucket to hold water was comical.
meanings.sent4: The impuissance of the old bridge was evident as it creaked under the weight.
meanings.sent5: The impuissance of the worn-out pencil made writing a challenge.

meanings.definition: Helplessness or inability to achieve a desired outcome.
meanings.sent1: The impuissance of the team in scoring goals cost them the match.
meanings.sent2: Her impuissance in convincing others led to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent3: The impuissance of the cat to catch the laser pointer was amusing.
meanings.sent4: The impuissance of the broken compass left them wandering in circles.
meanings.sent5: The impuissance of the locked door trapped them inside the room.
